intro: Astronia foxworthyi, commonly known as the foxworthys' astronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. It features opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Astronia foxworthyi is primarily found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
